algorithm_technique: Sliding window with a deque to store indices of potential maximums in decreasing order.
problem_summary_simple: Find the maximum value in each sliding window of size k as it moves across an array.
problem_summary_technical: Employs a deque to maintain candidate maximums, ensuring the front of the deque always holds the index of the maximum element in the current window.
key_insights: The deque stores indices, not values, allowing for efficient removal of elements that are no longer in the window.
Elements in the deque are maintained in decreasing order of their corresponding values in `nums`.
When a new element is considered, smaller elements at the end of the deque are removed because they can never be the maximum.
